text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/17126b13969c3b91516a8e9ff80fb6a1f6924d40|patch 8.2.2311: Vim9: cannot assign to variable that shadows command …>
patch 8.2.2311: Vim9: cannot assign to variable that shadows command modifier

Problem:    Vim9: cannot assign to a variable that shadows a command modifier.
Solution:   Check for assignment after possible command modifier.
            (closes #7632)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2311: Vim9: cannot assign to variable that shadows command … · vim/vim@17126b1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2311: Vim9: cannot assign to variable that shadows command … · vim/vim@17126b1
attachments.text: …modifier Problem: Vim9: cannot assign to a variable that shadows a command modifier. Solution: Check for assignment after possible command modifier. (closes #7632)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/43b69b39acb85a2aab2310cba5a2dbac338a4eb9|patch 8.2.2310: Vim9: winsaveview() return type is too generic>
patch 8.2.2310: Vim9: winsaveview() return type is too generic

Problem:    Vim9: winsaveview() return type is too generic.
Solution:   use dict instead of dict. (closes #7626)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2310: Vim9: winsaveview() return type is too generic · vim/vim@43b69b3
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2310: Vim9: winsaveview() return type is too generic · vim/vim@43b69b3

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c37b655443e0a11a77a9f0707e3259ab4b8b3dda|patch 8.2.2309: 0o777 not recognized as octal>
patch 8.2.2309: 0o777 not recognized as octal

Problem:    0o777 not recognized as octal.
Solution:   Use vim_isodigit(). (Ken Takata, closes #7633, closes #7631)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2309: 0o777 not recognized as octal · vim/vim@c37b655
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2309: 0o777 not recognized as octal · vim/vim@c37b655
attachments.text: Problem: 0o777 not recognized as octal. Solution: Use vim_isodigit(). (Ken Takata, closes #7633, closes #7631)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/328eac2b5d1569c57e1130ecb9f7cca733b84d78|patch 8.2.2308: Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref>
patch 8.2.2308: Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref

Problem:    Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref without return
            value.
Solution:   Default return value to "any". (closes #7629)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2308: Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref · vim/vim@328eac2
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2308: Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref · vim/vim@328eac2
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no error when assigning lambda to funcref without return value. Solution: Default return value to "any". (closes #7629)
